Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Mar 2019There are various ways you can go about doing this. I'll tell you about how I got started:Started by reading local financial blogs. Here are some that I read: https://blog.seedly.sg/http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/http://investmentmoats.com/http://singaporeanstocksinvestor.blogspot.com/https://dollarsandsense.sg/Tried reading some books. http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2017/07/recommended-books-on-personal-finance.htmlFrom the above 2 steps, I gained some knowledge; enough to get me started on investing. I also gained valuable lessons (which cost $$$ in terms of my losses) while I was investing.Recently, I signed up for a course that quite a few financial bloggers recommended. The course, even though it was made for beginners, was extremely enlightening for me. It organized the knowledge that I gained over the few years of investing extremely well. I would say that it would benefit me in the long run.So, if you have some money to spare, consider investing in an investment course. It is a shortcut to learning about investing. Of course, if you are not willing, you can always use the 2 points I listed above. They work well too :)0 comments1
